Create Venn Diagram from Differential Expression Comparisons

Source: R/customized_vis.R
venn_plots.Rd

This function performs multiple pairwise differential expression comparisons between groups and visualizes the overlap of significantly differentially expressed genes using an area-proportional Venn/Euler diagram.

venn_plots(
  object,
  comparisons,
  idents,
  direction = "up",
  log2fc_threshold = 0.58,
  min_pct = 0.3,
  p_adj_cutoff = 0.05,
  fills = NULL,
  alpha = 0.6,
  main = NULL,
  subtitle = NULL,
  label_cex = 1.2,
  quantity_cex = 1,
  file_name = "eulerr_plot",
  ...
)

Arguments

object

A Seurat object containing expression data and metadata

comparisons

Named list where names are comparison labels (e.g., "Group A vs Group B") and values are character vectors of length 2 specifying which groups to compare (e.g., c("Group A", "Group B")). Must contain between 3 and 6 comparisons.

idents

Character string specifying the metadata column containing group identities. This column will be set as the active identity.

direction

Character string specifying which genes to include in the Venn. Options are "up" (upregulated in ident.1), "down" (downregulated in ident.1), or "both". Default is "up".

log2fc_threshold

Numeric value specifying the minimum absolute log2 fold change threshold for significance. Default is 0.58.

min_pct

Numeric value specifying the minimum fraction of cells expressing the gene in either group. Default is 0.3.

p_adj_cutoff

Numeric value for adjusted p-value cutoff. Default is 0.05.

fills

Character vector of colors for the Venn diagram circles. If NULL, a default palette will be used. Length should match the number of comparisons.

alpha

Numeric value between 0 and 1 for transparency of circles. Default is 0.6.

main

Character string for the main title. If NULL, a default title will be generated. Default is NULL.

subtitle

Character string for subtitle. If NULL, parameters will be shown. Default is NULL.

label_cex

Numeric value for label text size. Default is 1.2.

quantity_cex

Numeric value for quantity text size. Default is 1.0.

file_name

Output png file name. Default is eulerr_plot.

...

Additional arguments passed to eulerr::euler()

Value

A list containing:

markers

A named list of data frames, one per comparison, containing full differential expression results from FindMarkers

genes

A named list of character vectors containing the filtered gene names that passed the thresholds for each comparison

euler_fit

The fitted euler object

plot

The plot is drawn directly; returns invisible

Details

The function performs the following steps:

  1. Sets the specified metadata column as active identity

  2. Performs pairwise differential expression using Seurat::FindMarkers

  3. Filters genes based on p_adj, log2FC, and direction criteria

  4. Creates an area-proportional Venn/Euler diagram showing overlaps

For "up" direction, genes are filtered where avg_log2FC > log2fc_threshold. For "down" direction, genes are filtered where avg_log2FC < -log2fc_threshold. For "both" direction, genes are filtered where |avg_log2FC| > log2fc_threshold.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Custom comparisons with named list
comparisons <- list(
  "Chronic vs ACTG" = c("Chronic Post-DAA Conserved", "ACTG Post-DAA Conserved"),
  "Chronic vs SR" = c("Chronic Post-DAA Conserved", "SR ≥24W-post-resolution unknown"),
  "ACTG vs SR" = c("ACTG Post-DAA Conserved", "SR ≥24W-post-resolution unknown")
)

result <- venn_plots(
  object = object,
  comparisons = comparisons,
  idents = "Cohort_tp_mutation",
  log2fc_threshold = 0.58,
  min_pct = 0.3,
  main = "Upregulated Genes"
)

# Look at downregulated genes
comparisons <- list(
  "A vs B" = c("Group1", "Group2"),
  "A vs C" = c("Group1", "Group3"),
  "B vs C" = c("Group2", "Group3")
)

venn_plots(
  object = object,
  comparisons = comparisons,
  idents = "treatment",
  direction = "down",
  log2fc_threshold = 0.5
)

# Access results
result$markers  # Full marker data frames
result$genes    # Filtered gene lists
} # }
